versioning.note: Each API group has its own version. Check the SP-API changelog before upgrading.

api_groups.name: Orders API
api_groups.description: Retrieve and manage orders. Polling-based — no webhooks for order creation.

api_groups.name: Catalog Items API
api_groups.description: Search and retrieve Amazon catalog data (product details, images, attributes).

api_groups.name: Listings Items API
api_groups.description: Create, update, and delete seller product listings.

api_groups.name: FBA Inventory API
api_groups.description: Query FBA (Fulfilled by Amazon) inventory levels and summaries.

api_groups.name: Fulfillment Outbound API
api_groups.description: Multi-Channel Fulfillment (MCF) — request Amazon to ship FBA inventory to non-Amazon buyers.

api_groups.name: Reports API
api_groups.description: Async report generation for bulk data. Preferred over per-item polling for large datasets.

api_groups.name: Feeds API
api_groups.description: Submit large batches of data (price updates, inventory, listings) via XML/JSON feeds.

auth.summary: OAuth2 (LWA) for access token + AWS Signature Version 4 for request signing

sandbox.note: Static sandbox responses for most endpoints. Test order IDs and ASINs provided in SP-API docs.

common_gotchas: Order line items are NOT returned by getOrders — always call getOrderItems separately.
SP-API requires BOTH an LWA access token AND AWS SigV4 signing on every request.
Rate limits vary significantly per endpoint — do not apply a single global limit.
The Feeds API is mandatory for bulk operations (>100 items). Do not loop putListingsItem.
Marketplace IDs differ by region: ATVPDKIKX0DER (US), A1F83G8C2ARO7P (UK), A13V1IB3VIYZZH (FR).
